column1: The surgeon made an incision (cut) in your skin to expose the bones and joint of your big toe.
You may have swelling in your foot.
You may be able to put some weight on your foot and walk short distances 2 or 3 weeks after surgery.
You will need to do exercises that will strengthen the muscles around your ankle and maintain the range of motion in your foot.
Taking ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) or another anti-inflammatory medicine may also help.
- You have swelling, pain, and redness in your calf muscle.
